alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 10:01AM EST until January 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County. .Moderate to heavy rain will fall on the snowpack leading to the melt increasing runoff from the storm. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach action levels. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 19.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 17.5 feet Sunday morning. It will rise to 18.9 feet Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
